CatDescriptText: Charles Smithson, South Hills High sophomore, 3245 Arlington Heights and Gladys Scott, 3235 Arlington Avenue, were part of the "Pittsburghers Speak Up" column published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, November 2, 1957, pg. 2, with question: "Do you believe that one political party should be in control of all the offices in city, county, and state?" Charles Smithson's answer reads: "No, I don't think so. If there's too much power in one party, that is not good government."  Mrs. Gladys Scott's answer reads: "I'm not too familiar with politics.  I understand that the offices are all in the hands of one party now and I think that things are pretty good.  I'm satisfied and believe that if things were mixed up they would be worse."
TitMainTitle: Charles Smithson wearing jacket with light colored buttons and name patch over breast pocket, and Gladys Scott wearing dark coat with fur trimmed collar, standing outdoors with building in background
